titleStmt.title: The Zurich 'Chorherrenstube' Inventory (1698), ed. Claudio Bacciagaluppi, 2012 (Historical Music Inventories, ###)

publicationStmt.publisher: Swiss RISM Office, Université de Fribourg, Switzerland

msContents.summary: The music society 'auf der Chorherren-Stube' was founded 1613 in Zurich. It merged in 1772 with the society 'zur deutschen Schule' into the society 'der mehreren Stadt', which in its turn was one of the two building in 1812 the 'Allgemeine Musik-Gesellschaft', still in existence today. In 1698, however, a reorganisation took place: three members of the existing society decided to make a fresh start. On this occasion the document described hereafter was laid out. The 'Acta / Einer Lobl: MusicGesell- / schafft auf der Chor- / herren Stuben' (CH-Zz, AMG Archiv IV A 6) contain the protocols of the periodical general assemblies of the society in the years 1698–1743. After some blank pages, a list of the members is found, and later on some accounts and a short inventory of 20 titles (the 21st item is crossed out). All sections of the book were laid out on first compiling the volume, but interrupted at different stages. The protocols were continued until 1743. The member list was updated until 1735. The society’s income was last registered in 1726, the expenses in 1737. The last entry in the inventory dates to 1714 or soon afterwards. This date appears by item no. 17, entered in the same handwriting of items nos. 18 to 21; and no. 18 is possibly a print from 1718. The previous scribe’s name is unknown; most probably, it was the renovated society’s first 'actuarius', or secretary, Hans Heinrich Hirzel (who was elected during the founding session, as reported on p. 2).
